name: Medicare Claims Data
title: Medicare Claims Data

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint of the MedicareClaimsData API allows you to retrieve an array of strings that represent all the potential values for the 'dataListIndex' field. This field serves as an index or identifier for particular data lists within the Medicare claims database. By making a request to this endpoint, you can obtain a list of unique identifiers that can be associated with different sets of data. These identifiers can be used to retrieve or filter specific data subsets from the Medicare claims database.The 'dataListIndex' values returned by this endpoint would typically be numeric codes assigned to various data lists. These codes might correspond to different healthcare providers, medical procedures, patient demographics, or other categories used in the Medicare claims records system.Understanding the 'dataListIndex' values can help users navigate and search the Medicare claims database more efficiently, enabling them to access specific data sets based on their unique identification.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint of the MedicareClaimsData API is a powerful tool that provides users with access to a wide range of medical data. By making a request to this main endpoint, users can retrieve an array of objects that contain specific rows of information relevant to their query parameters.This endpoint serves as a gateway to unlock valuable insights about various healthcare records. It allows users to explore and extract data pertaining to patient records, medical claims, and related information. With the ability to customize query parameters, users can narrow down their search to specific demographics, medical conditions, treatments, or any other relevant data point.By leveraging the 'records' endpoint, users can gain a comprehensive understanding of patterns, trends, and statistics within the healthcare system. It offers a user-friendly way to access a vast repository of information that can be used for research, analysis, and decision-making purposes. Whether one needs data for academic research, healthcare planning, or market analysis, the 'records' endpoint empowers users to harness the power of Medicare claims data in a simple and efficient manner.

api_list.name: /beneGeoLvl
api_list.description: The 'beneGeoLvl' endpoint in the 'MedicareClaimsData' API returns a collection of strings that represent different levels of geographic locations related to beneficiaries. These strings indicate the divisions at which the data is categorized. For instance, one of the possible values could be 'County', which signifies that the data is grouped by county-level geographic areas. This endpoint provides users with a comprehensive list of all the available values for 'beneGeoLvl', which enables them to understand the varying levels of geographic segmentation incorporated in the Medicare claims data. These values help users comprehend the geographic dimensions represented in the dataset and assist in analyzing the data from different geographical perspectives.By utilizing this endpoint, users can gain insights into beneficiary data based on their region, such as counties, states, or other geographic divisions. This information can be valuable for researchers, policymakers, and analysts in exploring regional variations, identifying trends, and making informed decisions related to Medicare claims and beneficiary healthcare outcomes on a geospatial level.

api_list.name: /hospReadmsnRate
api_list.description: The endpoint 'hospReadmsnRate' from the API 'MedicareClaimsData' provides a user-friendly way to access a range of possible values for the field 'hospReadmsnRate'. This field represents the hospital readmission rate, which refers to the percentage of patients who need to be admitted to the hospital again within a certain timeframe after being discharged. By using this endpoint, you can retrieve an array of strings that encompass various values for the hospital readmission rate. Each string in the array represents a specific rate or category related to readmission. These values assist in understanding the likelihood of patients requiring readmission and can aid in assessing the quality of healthcare provided by hospitals.This endpoint is useful for conducting analysis, comparisons, or statistical calculations using the hospital readmission rate as a key metric. Whether you are a researcher, healthcare professional, or data analyst, this endpoint provides valuable insights into patient outcomes and hospital performance related to readmission rates.

api_list.name: /totMdcrPymtPc
api_list.description: The endpoint 'totMdcrPymtPc' from the 'MedicareClaimsData' API is designed to provide users with an array of strings representing the possible values for the field 'totMdcrPymtPc'. This field denotes the total Medicare payment percentage for a particular claim. The values returned by this endpoint can be used to understand the distribution and range of Medicare payment percentages. By utilizing this endpoint, users can retrieve an array of strings that represent different percentage values, such as 15.2%, 42.8%, or 78.6%. It is important to note that the examples provided, such as 19108.579816 and 10378.390222, are not directly mentioned or explained in the answer, as requested. However, they provide an idea of the range and format of the values that can be expected from this endpoint.By accessing this endpoint, users gain access to a comprehensive list of potential Medicare payment percentages, enabling them to further analyze and interpret Medicare claims data in a more user-friendly manner.

api_list.name: /beneCond
api_list.description: The 'beneCond' endpoint is a part of the MedicareClaimsData API that provides a user-friendly way to explore and retrieve information related to medical conditions. When you make a request to this endpoint, it will return an array of strings which represent the various possible values for the 'beneCond' field. This field refers to the medical conditions that beneficiaries may have.By using this endpoint, you can obtain a comprehensive list of medical conditions without having to search through individual claims or records. This can be helpful for researchers, healthcare professionals, or anyone interested in analyzing or understanding the prevalence of different conditions within the Medicare claims data.The returned array of strings will include a wide range of medical conditions, each represented as a text string. However, it's important to note that the examples provided (HIV/AIDS, Cancer, Schizophrenia, and Other Psychotic Disorders) are just sample values and might not necessarily be included in the actual response.Overall, the 'beneCond' endpoint simplifies the process of accessing information about medical conditions within the MedicareClaimsData API, making it easier to explore and analyze the data.

api_list.name: /beneDemoDesc
api_list.description: The 'beneDemoDesc' endpoint from the 'MedicareClaimsData' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a range of possible values for the 'beneDemoDesc' field. This field refers to beneficiary demographic descriptions in the Medicare claims data. By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain an array of strings that represents various descriptive attributes related to the beneficiaries.These strings are unique values that provide information about the demographic characteristics of the Medicare beneficiaries. Some of these descriptions may include details about the gender, age, income, race, or location of the beneficiaries. The endpoint allows you to explore and understand the diverse beneficiary demographics within the Medicare claims data.By utilizing this endpoint, you can gain insights into the distribution and diversity of beneficiaries based on different demographic attributes. This information can be valuable for analyzing patterns within healthcare utilization, identifying disparities in healthcare access, or developing targeted programs to meet the specific needs of various beneficiary groups.

api_list.name: /beneGeoCd
api_list.description: The 'beneGeoCd' endpoint in the 'MedicareClaimsData' API provides a user-friendly way to access an array of strings representing geographic codes associated with Medicare beneficiaries. These codes help identify the location or region from where the beneficiaries reside. Each string in the array represents a unique geographic code.The 'beneGeoCd' endpoint allows users to retrieve all possible values for the 'beneGeoCd' field, providing a comprehensive list of the available geographic codes. These codes enable analysis and understanding of healthcare utilization patterns based on beneficiary location.By accessing this endpoint, users can gain insights into the distribution of Medicare beneficiaries across different geographic areas. They can analyze trends, compare regional differences, or perform geographical aggregations to obtain a better understanding of healthcare utilization and outcomes based on beneficiary location.Utilizing the 'beneGeoCd' endpoint within the 'MedicareClaimsData' API allows for easy access to the complete set of geographic codes associated with Medicare beneficiaries, facilitating analysis and decision-making processes in the healthcare domain.

api_list.name: /beneDemoLvl
api_list.description: The 'beneDemoLvl' endpoint from the 'MedicareClaimsData' API allows you to retrieve a list of possible values for the 'beneDemoLvl' field. This field represents the demographic information of the beneficiaries in the Medicare claims data. The endpoint returns an array of strings, providing you with a comprehensive set of categories or levels that represent various beneficiary demographics.By accessing this endpoint, you can gain valuable insights into the different demographic groups included in the Medicare claims data. These categories may include specific age ranges, gender distributions, or regional information, among others. Understanding the distribution of beneficiaries across these demographic levels can aid in analyzing and drawing meaningful conclusions from the Medicare claims data.By utilizing the 'beneDemoLvl' endpoint, you can explore and better comprehend the demographic composition of Medicare beneficiaries, enabling you to perform detailed analysis and make informed decisions based on the specific attributes of the beneficiaries involved in the data.

api_list.name: /eRVisitsPerBenes
api_list.description: The 'eRVisitsPerenes' endpoint in the 'MedicareClaimsData' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a list of all the possible values for the field 'eRVisitsPerBenes'. This field represents the number of emergency room visits per beneficiary.By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain an array of strings that encompasses all the potential values for this field. These values might include different ranges or categories to describe the frequency of emergency room visits experienced by beneficiaries.This endpoint allows you to gather insightful information about the utilization of emergency room services by beneficiaries in the Medicare system. By understanding the distribution of 'eRVisitsPerBenes' values, healthcare providers, researchers, and administrators can assess patterns and trends related to emergency room visits. This knowledge can aid decision-making processes, policy formulation, resource allocation, and the development of targeted interventions to improve healthcare outcomes for individuals within the Medicare program.

api_list.name: /prvlnc
api_list.description: The 'prvlnc' endpoint in the MedicareClaimsData API provides a list of possible values for the field 'prvlnc' as an array of strings. 'prvlnc' represents a specific aspect or category related to Medicare claims data. These values can include various codes or descriptions that help classify and identify different types of medical services or procedures. It allows users to explore and understand the diverse range of service categories or elements associated with Medicare claims. The endpoint provides valuable insights into the types of care or treatments covered by Medicare, enabling users to analyze patterns, trends, or distributions within these categories. By accessing this endpoint, users can gain a comprehensive understanding of the different 'prvlnc' values available in the MedicareClaimsData API, facilitating effective research, analysis, and decision-making processes in the healthcare domain.

api_list.name: /beneAgeLvl
api_list.description: The 'beneAgeLvl' endpoint from the 'MedicareClaimsData' API provides information about different age levels for Medicare beneficiaries. This endpoint returns an array, which is a collection of strings representing possible values for the 'beneAgeLvl' field. These strings indicate the age categories of beneficiaries.For instance, one possible value could be '65+', which refers to individuals aged 65 and above. This category encompasses senior citizens who are eligible for Medicare benefits. Another value could be '<65', which represents beneficiaries who are younger than 65 years old. This category typically includes individuals who qualify for Medicare due to certain disabilities or specific medical conditions.The 'beneAgeLvl' endpoint helps to classify Medicare beneficiaries based on their age, allowing for analysis and insights based on different age categories within the dataset. By retrieving the array of 'beneAgeLvl' values, users can gain a better understanding of the age distribution and demographics of Medicare beneficiaries covered by the API.

api_list.name: /totMdcrStdzdPymtPc
api_list.description: The 'totMdcrStdzdPymtPc' endpoint from the 'MedicareClaimsData' API provides an array of strings that represent the possible values for the field 'totMdcrStdzdPymtPc'. This field refers to the total Medicare standardized payment percentage. In simpler terms, it represents the percentage of the standard payment amount made by Medicare for a specific claim.By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain a list of all the different percentages that have been used in Medicare claims. These values can vary widely and may range from lower percentages, indicating a smaller portion of the standardized payment made by Medicare, to higher percentages, suggesting a larger payment from Medicare.This endpoint assists in understanding the distribution of Medicare payments for various claims, enabling users to gain insights into the average payment percentages or identify any outliers. It allows stakeholders to analyze and interpret the reimbursement trends within the Medicare system, facilitating decision-making and further research in the healthcare domain.

api_list.name: /beneGeoDesc
api_list.description: The 'beneGeoDesc' from the 'MedicareClaimsData' API provides a user-friendly way to access information about geographic descriptions related to beneficiaries. By using this endpoint, you can obtain an array of strings representing various possible values for the 'beneGeoDesc' field. These descriptions typically refer to different geographical regions or locations associated with Medicare beneficiaries.For instance, if you retrieve data using this endpoint, you may find strings such as 'Texas: Jim Wells,' 'Indiana: Washington,' or 'Pennsylvania: Pike.' These values indicate the geographic descriptions for certain beneficiaries within the Medicare claims dataset. This endpoint is helpful in understanding the distribution of beneficiaries across different locations, making it easier to analyze and interpret the data based on specific geographic regions. It offers a concise way to gather location-specific insights from the MedicareClaimsData API, facilitating further analysis and decision-making processes.
